page.title: 20GRAVELEY and GARDEN CENTRE
page.content: Travelling northwards out of Stevenage along the old Great North Road you come to a garden centre. This centre has grown with Stevenage. It has a wide range of plants for the house and garden. Garden centres are very popular these days because people like to have attractive plants in their homes and gardens but like to buy them already growing instead of growing them from seeds. A quarter of a mile along the road is the little village of Graveley. It is very old. It was given to William Ewe by William the Conqueror. The Normans built a church in the village but there is only a small part of it left now most of the church has been added by other people since then. There are two pubs in the village and up the lane behind one of them are two ponds with a lot of ducks and some moorhens and fish.
